contentrichtext.text: '''BR''' or '''Br''' may refer to: {{TOCright}} == Places == * [[Bedroom]] * [[BR postcode area]], a group of eight postal districts in southeast London * [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana]] * [[Brazil]] (BR), according to: ** Its two-letter country code defined in [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] ** The prefix for [[ISO 3166-2:BR|Brazil's ISO 3166-2 subdivision codes]] ** [[List of FIPS country codes|FIPS 10-4]], used by the U.S. Government for geographical data processing in many publications * The [[Province of Brindisi]], according to Italy's ISO 3166-2 subdivision codes * [[Brown County, Kansas]], according to its Kansas state county code, which is used on the state's license plates * [[BrÄƒila]], a town and county in [[Romania]]. BR is used in the county's license plates == Business and organizations == * BR, the symbol used by Petrobras Distribuidora, the fuel retail division of [[Petrobras]] * [[Banana Republic (clothing retailer)]], a chain of clothing stores * [[Bernstein-Rein]], the ad agency best known for inventing the Happy Meal * [[Bangladesh Railway]] * [[British Rail]] (British Railways), the nationalised railway system of the United Kingdom from 1948 until 1994 * [[Burlington Resources]], a company purchased by ConocoPhillips in 2006 * The IATA code for [[EVA Air]], a Taiwanese airline * [[Bharat Rakshak]], Consortium of Indian Military Websites * [[Baskin-Robbins]], a chain of ice cream parlors * Business Registration == Science == * [[Bromine]] (Br), chemical element with atomic number 35 * BR is the standard abbreviation for [[Polybutadiene]], a type of rubber<ref>The Open University (UK), 2000. ''T838 Design and Manufacture with Polymers: Introduction to Polymers'', page 9. Milton Keynes: The Open University.</ref> * [[Bacteriorhodopsin]] == Computing == * <tt>[[.br]]</tt>, country code top-level domain for Brazil * [[Newline]] element in: ** [[XHTML]] (<code><nowiki><br /></nowiki></code>) ** [[HTML]] (<code>[[HTML_element#Other_inline_elements|<nowiki><br></nowiki>]]</code>) * [[Bombing Run]], an Unreal Tournament gametype introduced in Unreal Tournament 2003 * [[Block / Remove]], used in social networks and dating sites, as well as instant messaging programs == Music and media == * ''[[Battle Royale]]'', a Japanese book, movie and manga * [[Bad Religion]], an American punk-rock band * [[Bleacher Report]], an online sports media network * [[Bohemian Rhapsody]] * [[Bayerischer Rundfunk]] (Bavarian Broadcasting), a regional broadcasting service in Germany == Other uses == * br, [[Breton language]] in ISO 639-1 language code * [[Bankruptcy]] (B/R in legal shorthand) or representing a debtor who has filed bankruptcy * [[Red Brigades]] (Italian: ''{{lang|it|Brigate Rosse}}''), an Italian militant leftist group * Bathroom in [[List of Internet slang phrases|Internet slang]] * [[Bishop Ramsey School]], a Church of England Voluntary Aided secondary school in [[Ruislip]] * BR = Best Regards, when it appears at the end of an e-mail, before the sender's name. * BR = Battle Rifle, a weapon in the Xbox series, [[Halo (series)|Halo]]. * Br., abbreviation for ''brother'', used by [[Brother (Catholic)|Catholic brothers]] and [[Friar]]s. * ''Br'' is a symbol for [[Belarusian ruble]]. *[[Brendan Rodgers]], manager of [[Liverpool F.C.]] == See also == * [[Battle Royale (disambiguation)]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{disambiguation}}
